page.title: 20 The Playing Field.
page.content: The Playing Field is a ten acre field on the northern side of Byfield road next to the electricity substation grid reference 544531. There are young Ash, beech and sycamore trees with hawthorn and blackthorn hedging on the southern and eastern sides,and wire fences on the northern and western boundaries. There is a 40 by 40 foot car park at the SW entrance.A 24 by 14 foot concrete sectional pavilion and brick lavatory block,both with mains water and a septic tank,lie in the NW corner. The land is owned by Woodford-cum- Membris Parish Council,who sell the hay crop from the southern 6 acres annually by tender(30 bales per acre yield).The top(flat) 4 acres are used as a cricket pitch in summer and for football in winter.Daventry Dog Training Club use the field for agility training.Cattle and sheep are prohibited by byelaw.
